Introduction & Background

I've worked as a photographer, reporter, editor and various other jobs in journalism and government. For the past 11 years or more, web development has been my growing passion. From 2005 to 2015, I worked as a multimedia specialist for the Wyoming Department of Workforce Services' Research & Planning section, building static websites and editing publications and online content. Not content with producing static websites the same way every day, I began to learn new web technologies and methods, including javascript, Jekyll, Flexbox, Foundation, Bootstrap, WordPress, Grunt, Gulp, Git, Bower, Sublime Text, and much more.

Buzzwords

HTML   CSS   Adobe InDesign   Adobe Illustrator   Adobe Photoshop   Adobe Dreamweaver   WordPress  

Work Experience

Title Start Date End Date Company Role
Substitute Teacher 2017 Ongoing Cypress-Fairbanks School District, Cypress TX Perform the duties of a teacher in the teacher’s absence, in accordance with instructions and policies of the teacher, school and district. Includes administering tests, maintaining classroom discipline. Instructs students at the high school level in a wide array of topics.
Hardlines Sales Team Member 2015 Ongoing Target Corporation Primary duties include assisting guests in a busy retail environment, handling cash and inventory, restocking merchandise and assisting other team members.
Publications and Web Editor 2005 2015 Wyoming Dept. of Workforce Services, Research & Planning, Casper, WY Primary duties were editing and layout of hard-copy publications, and development of websites and web content for the state’s websites related to Labor Market Information and statistical analysis conducted by the Wyoming Department of Workforce Services' Research & Planning section. Oversaw publication of the monthly Wyoming Labor Force Trends, the Wyoming Workforce Annual Report, and numerous other publications and web pages. Served as Wyoming's representative on the Analyst Resource Center’s Workforce Information Database consortium from 2007-2015 and as chair of the national ARC Education and Communication Subcommittee.
